derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from French flaccide or Latin flaccidus, from flaccus 'flabby'

entry.tran: (人体某部分)松弛的，松垂的，绵软的
entry.def: You use flaccid to describe a part of someone's body when it is unpleasantly soft and not hard or firm.

example.ex: I picked up her wrist. It was limp and flaccid.
example.tran: 我抓起她绵软无力的手腕。

means.word_mean: 1. lacking in strength or firmness or resilience;

sentences.sentence: "a limp gesture as if waving away all desire to know" G.K.Chesterton

stems_affixes.word_buile: flacc松开+id如……的→adj.松驰的,软弱的

sta站着+id如……的→adj.稳重的,沉着的
turg肿大+id如……的→adj.浮肿的,浮夸的
